snippet: The decision ended a 15-year boycott and lends credibility to government promises that the a parliamentary vote on May 10 will be more democratic than in the past.
abstract: Algeria's largest opposition party, the secularist Front of Socialist Forces, says it will take part in country's parliamentary election, ending a 15-year boycott and lending credibility to government promises that vote will be more democratic than in the past.
lead_paragraph: The decision ended a 15-year boycott and lends credibility to government promises that the a parliamentary vote on May 10 will be more democratic than in the past.
